definition: 4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise

sentences.english: With him went the noble levy and the private magnate armies.
sentences.chinese: 徵募的貴族民團和權貴的私軍與他同行。

sentences.english: And out of the $800 million that Obama raised, $700 million came from corporations and rich donors.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬徵募的8億競選費，有7億是來自公司和富人。

sentences.english: Certain age groups will be balloted at this time.
sentences.chinese: 這次對某年齡組的人徵募。

sentences.english: We should check whether there is any questions about recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該檢查對徵募新兵是否有疑問。

sentences.english: Do you think Mitt or Sarah can raise that kind of money.
sentences.chinese: 你認爲米特和薩拉佩林能徵募到那些人的錢麼？

sentences.english: If you can’t defend yourself, recruit an army.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能保護自己，那徵募一個部隊吧。

sentences.english: For the master to enlist your help, he surely thought highly of your abilities.
sentences.chinese: 讓總領徵募你的幫助，他一定認爲你的能力很高。

sentences.english: The government will commandeer ships only in wartime.
sentences.chinese: 政府只會在戰爭期間徵募船隻。

sentences.english: The country's first act would be to recruit for the navy.
sentences.chinese: 國家的第一個行動是爲海軍徵募新兵。

sentences.english: How do you recruit an army?

pinyin: Di4 yi1 ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: (Claire) Chennault, commander of Flying Tigers during World War II
Dhaka, capital of Bangladesh/(Tw) Dakar, capital of Senegal
an ambassador of the church/an Apostolic Nuncio (from the Vatican)
to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
Yekaterinburg (Russian city, also known as Ekaterinburg or Sverdlovsk)
